intro: Dendropanax alaris, commonly known as the silver tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its distinctive silver-white undersides on its leaves. The plant grows as a tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a waxy coating that contributes to its striking appearance. Dendropanax alaris is well adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in forested areas.
